src:
VBA razbija Grnčariju
Dodatni motiv za lidera biće i želja da se iskupi za neplanirano izgubljene bodove u mečevima sa Barnslijem i Čarltonom na domaćem terenu

04 Nov 2019

Stouk i Vest Bromvič Albion u derbi Zapadnog Midlendsa ulaze sa različitih krajeva tabele Čempionšipa, samim tim i u potpuno oprečnim raspoloženjima.
Posle vezanih poraza na gostovanjima Šefild Venzdeju i Milvolu Grnčari su se ponovo našli na pretposlednjoj poziciji (Barnsli je iza njih samo zbog nešto lošije gol-razlike) i raspršili nade navijača da su pobede nad kandidatima za promociju Svonsijem i Fulamom bile nagoveštaj berićetne pozne jeseni. Inače, taj trijumf protiv ekipe srpskog reprezentativca Aleksandra Mitrovića bio je prvi ovosezonski na domaćem terenu, a prethodilo mu je čak pet poraza i remi sa Derbijem, pa dolazak jednog od najboljih gostiju s razlogom raspiruje zebnju kod pulena velškog stručnjaka Nejtana Džonsa i njihovih pristalica.
Dodatni motiv za lidera biće i želja da se iskupi za neplanirano izgubljene bodove u mečevima sa Barnslijem i Čarltonom na domaćem terenu. Srećom po VBA, najbliži pratioci takođe su kiksirali i donekle ga rasteretili, što bi trebalo da mu olakša u nameri da se na Hotorns vrati sa čitavim plenom – a to bi bila treća pobeda Begisa u gradu na Trentu od 2015.
Ni Džons, ni njegov kolega, nekadašnji selektor Hrvatske Slaven Bilić nemaju većih kadrovskih problema i to je još jedna prevaga u korist Vest Broma, čija gostovanja najčešće donose 2-3 gola. Taj tip predlažemo onima koji ne smeju da odigraju dvojku ili makar X2&2+.

ČEMPIONŠIP - 15. KOLO

PetakBarnsli - Bristol Siti 2:2 (0:1)/Halme 77, Vudrou 90+4 - Vilijams 43, Vajman 71/
SubotaVigan - Svonsi 1:2 (1:1)/Mur 21p - Dajer 12, Saridž 91/
Blekburn - Šefild Venzdej 2:1 (0:0)/Adrabiojo 88, Bakli 90+1 - Marfi 83/
Brentford - Hadersfild 0:1 (0:0)/Ahirn-Grant 62/
Derbi - Midlzbro 2:0 (1:0)/Lorens 22, 84/
Fulam - Hal 0:3 (0:1)/Bauler 9, Bauen 57, Ivs 85/
Kardif - Birmingem 4:2 (2:1)/Rals 30, 69, 95p - Pedersen 3, Šunjić 89/
Lids - KPR 2:0 (1:0)/Roberts 39, Herison 82/
Luton - Notingem 1:2 (0:1)/Mekmanaman 87 - Graban 39, Ameobi 58/
Reding - Milvol 2:1 (2:0)/Obita 9, Baldok 37 - Volas 63/
NedeljaČarlton - Preston 0:1 (0:0)/Galager 58pen/

Ponedeljak21.00: (2,95) Stouk (3,25) Vest Bromvič (2,45)


*** kvote su podložne promenama




Foto: Reuters
text:
VBA breaks Pottery
An additional motive for the leader will be the desire to redeem himself for unplanned points lost in home matches with Barnsley and Charlton

04 Nov 2019

Stoke and West Bromwich Albion enter the West Midlands derby from different corners of the Championship table, and thus in completely opposite moods.
After tied defeats at away Sheffield Wednesday and Millwall, the Potters returned to the penultimate position (Barnsley behind them only for a slightly worse goal-difference) and dispelled fans' hopes that victory over promotion candidates Swansea and Fulham were a hint of a biracial late fall. Otherwise, that triumph against Serbian national teammate Aleksandar Mitrovic was his first on the domestic court this season, with five defeats and a draw against Derby, and the arrival of one of the best guests for a reason stirs up anxiety at the pulpit of Welsh expert Nathan Jones and their supporters.
An additional motive for the leader will also be the desire to redeem himself for unplanned points lost in home matches with Barnsley and Charlton. Fortunately according to the VBA, the closest companions also squatted and somewhat relieved him, which should make it easier for him to return to the Hotorns with all the spoils - and this would be Begis' third victory in the city on Trent since 2015.
Neither Jones, nor his colleague, former Croatian coach Slaven Bilic, have major personnel problems, and this is another advantage in favor of West Brom, whose away appearances are usually 2-3 goals. We suggest this type to those who are not allowed to play two or at least X2 & 2 +.

CHAMPIONSHIP - ROUND 15

FridayBarnsley - Bristol City 2: 2 (0: 1) / Halme 77, Woodrow 90 + 4 - Williams 43, Wyman 71 /
SaturdayWigan - Swansea 1: 2 (1: 1) / Moore 21p - Dyer 12, Saridge 91 /
Blackburn - Sheffield Wednesday 2: 1 (0: 0) / Adrabiojo 88, Buckley 90 + 1 - Murphy 83 /
Brentford - Huddersfield 0: 1 (0: 0) / Ahirn-Grant 62 /
Derby - Middlesbrough 2: 0 (1: 0) / Lawrence 22, 84 /
Fulham - Hall 0: 3 (0: 1) / Bauler 9, Bauen 57, Ivs 85 /
Cardiff City - Birmingham 4: 2 (2: 1) / Rals 30, 69, 95p - Pedersen 3, Sunjic 89 /
Leeds - KPR 2: 0 (1: 0) / Roberts 39, Harrison 82 /
Luton - Nottingham 1: 2 (0: 1) / McMahman 87 - Graban 39, Ameobi 58 /
Reading - Millwall 2: 1 (2: 0) / Obita 9, Baldock 37 - Wallace 63 /
SundayCharlton - Preston 0: 1 (0: 0) / Gallagher 58pen /

Monday21.00: (2.95) Stoke (3.25) West Bromwich Albion (2.45)


*** quotas are subject to change
